newsitem.title: USA: Sears, Roebuck creates four brand management posts.
newsitem.headline: Sears, Roebuck creates four brand management posts.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck and Co said on Friday it created four brand management positions to oversee the retailer's efforts to market its major brands including Kenmore, Diehard, Craftsman, and Canyon River Blues/"Softer Side" apparel.
"Developing and cultivating our major brands are top marketing and merchandising priorities for Sears," said John Costello, senior executive vice president of marketing, in a statement.

The directors will report to Daniel Laughlin, vice president of strategic marketing. They will be responsible for all aspects of brand management including strategic development, advertising, merchandising, packaging and research, Sears said in a statement.
The four brand marketing directors are Brian Kelly for Kenmore; David Egeland for DieHard; Andy Ginger for Craftsman; and Glori Katz for Canyon River Blues/"Softer Side".

Prior to joining Sears, Egeland had been a brand manager at Kraft Foods Inc. Ginger had been national marketing manager for Sears home improvement business. Katz had been vice president of advertising at Jockey International before joining Sears. Kelly was most recently director of marketing-softlines at Sears.
Sears operates more than 2,700 stores offering apparel, home furnishings, hardware and automotive products.
